title: Set up a tenant
content:
Set up a tenant

Before setting up a tenant, make sure the lightweight SSO settings and email service are configured in Configurations, also prepare the following items:

  • License files
  • LDAP, SAML, or OAuth configuration information including LDAP certificate

The following persons are involved in the setup process:

  • Suite administrators
  • Tenant administrators

Tasks for suite administrators

This image outlines the tasks for suite administrators to perform in Suite Administration.

  1. Configure security related settings (such as Lightweight SSO, IdM signing key, and expiration period for access token) and email service settings.
  2. Upload license files in Licenses and add them to a license pool. For details, see How to create and edit a license and How to create and edit a license pool.
  3. Create a customer in Customers. For details, see How to create and edit a customer.
  4. Create an account for the customer in Accounts. For details, see How to create an account.
  5. Create a DB type user to serve as the tenant administrator. For details, see How to create a user.
    Use a general name for this user in case of future changes to the tenant administrator role.
  6. Create a tenant in Tenants for the account created and assign the tenant administrator just created. For details, see How to create and edit a tenant.
  7. Assign license capacity to the tenant just created. For details, see How to create and edit a tenant.
  8. Deploy the tenant. 
  9. Create users with DB authentication type, or add authentication configurations (LDAP, SAML, or OAuth) in the IdM Admin Portal if your organization wants to use LDAP, SAML, or OAuth authentication. For details, see Configure authentication in IdM Admin Portal.
  10. (Optional) Configure the password policies for the users. For details, see Configure password policy in IdM Admin Portal.

Tasks for tenant administrators

Tenant administrators can perform the following customization tasks in Service Management.

  1. Onboard users, including assigning roles, groups, licenses, etc. For details, see How to import users into the suite and How to assign licenses to users.
  2. Customize the Service Portal. For details, see Quick guide to customize the Service Portal.
  3. Customize the tenant based on your business requirements, including customizing forms, business rules, notifications, etc. For details, see Studio.

Enable Native SACM for a tenant

To use Native SACM for a tenant, you need to set up an external UCMDB server, install UCMDB Gateway, and then enable Native SACM in the tenant's applications. For details, see Deploy Native SACM.

Add Design and Deploy (DND) to an existing tenant

You can add the DND capability to an existing tenant. For details, see Deploy DND.

Add Cloud Cost Reporting to a tenant

You can add the Cloud Cost Reporting capability to a tenant. For details, see Enable Cloud Cost Reporting.

Add Software Asset Management (SAM) to a tenant

You can add SAM capability to a tenant. For details, see Enable SAM.
